New Records: Pakistan pulled off the biggest World Cup chase in history by chasing down 344 runs.
Mohammad Rizwan scored his highest ODI score with an unbeaten 131*.
Abdullah Shafique scored his first hundred in an ODI during his ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup debut.
Key Match Events: Kusal Mendis scored a stunning 77-ball 122 to help Sri Lanka reach 218 after 29 overs.
Hasan Ali, Shaheen Shah Afridi, and Haris Rauf bowled well to restrict Sri Lanka to 344.
Babar Azam was dismissed for 10, leaving Pakistan at 37/2.
Rizwan and Abdullah Shafique put on a 176-run partnership for the third wicket.
Saud Shakeel scored 31 from 30 deliveries to bring the target within reach.
Iftikhar Ahmed scored 22* from 10 balls to help conclude the game with 10 balls to spare.
Mohammad Rizwan suffered from cramp during his innings and was aided by Dasun Shanaka.
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammad Rizwan expressed that performing for his country and achieving such a chase was extremely special.
Rizwan mentioned that the team had belief in chasing the target at the midway point of the innings.
Rizwan credited the team's positive mindset and the performance of bowlers in restricting Sri Lanka.
Rizwan joked about his cramp, attributing his recovery to the team's physio.
Pakistan is in a strong early position in the tournament with two wins from two matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan is second in the table behind New Zealand on net run rate.
Pakistan's next big fixture is against India in Ahmedabad.
